item.title: Navi Mumbai to get a Woman Mayor!

blockquote.p: TLDR: Navi Mumbai is among 15 Maharashtra cities reserving mayoral posts for women. About time, honestly.

description.p: Get ready for a shakeup at NMMC headquarters! The state government just announced that Navi Mumbai, along with Pune, Nagpur, and Nashik, will have a woman mayor. Finally.
This isn't just about "girl power" (eye roll). The reservation applies to 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra. The move is part of a larger effort to, yo...

item.title: Power Bills About to Get Even MORE Annoying

blockquote.p: TLDR: Draft energy policy suggests linking power tariffs to inflation and reducing cross-subsidies. Prepare for even more creative ways to save electricity (or just move to Lonavala).

description.p: Hate your electricity bill? Get ready for round two. Some new draft policy is floating around that wants to link power tariffs to inflation. Meaning: when things get more expensive, your electricity bill does too.
And it doesn't stop there. The...

item.title: NMMC Election Results: Your New Corporators Are...

blockquote.p: TLDR: The NMMC election results are in, so get ready for some new faces running our city. Did your ward get someone competent, or just another guy who'll rename a chowk?

description.p: The final list of winning candidates from the BJP, Shiv Sena (UBT), MNS, and others is out. Sector 1's party scene is about to get a whole lot more interesting.
So, who's in? Check News18 for the full rundown. We're not going to list every single name; that's what inte...

item.title: New Navi Mumbai Airport: Hits and Misses

blockquote.p: TLDR: The new Navi Mumbai airport has some good features, but also some problems, typical of infrastructure projects here. It's shiny, but is it actually convenient?

description.p: So, Condé Nast Traveller India took a look at the new Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA), and, surprise, surprise, it's not all sunshine and imported sand. While the architecture looks impressive, and some of the tech is actually kinda cool, the report suggests some serious...

item.title: BJP Sweeps NMMC Elections: Opposition Crushed

blockquote.p: TLDR: The BJP dominated the 2026 NMMC elections. Turns out, people do like flyovers and promises of more development.

description.p: The saffron wave crashed over Navi Mumbai. The BJP steamrolled the competition in yesterday's NMMC elections, securing a majority that even their most optimistic supporters didn't predict. Forget a close contest; this was a demolition.
Early results trickled in from the polling centers near Nerul's Seawoods Gr...

item.title: CISF Cyclathon: Navi Mumbai gets sweaty, eco-friendly visit

blockquote.p: TLDR: CISF cyclists are rolling into Mumbai on February 11th as part of a massive coastal ride. Expect spandex and maybe some sore bums.

description.p: Get ready to dodge some lycra! The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is bringing its "Cyclathon 2026" to our fair city. We're picturing a peloton of very serious cyclists hitting the streets.
They're slated to arrive in Mumbai around February 11th. After battling headwinds and questionable coas...

item.title: NMMC Wins Award: Property Tax Gets Digital Upgrade

blockquote.p: TLDR: NMMC just snagged a Scotch Award for making property tax less of a headache. Seriously, anything that makes paying taxes slightly less soul-crushing is a win in our book.

description.p: NMMC is patting itself on the back. They won the Scotch Award 2025. Why? Because they dragged property tax kicking and screaming into the 21st century.
Apparently, their digital reforms and governance initiatives impressed the judges. Think online portals, strea...

item.title: Tailor arrested in Vashi for child sexual assault.

blockquote.p: TLDR: A 43-year-old tailor in Vashi got arrested for sexually assaulting a minor. What is wrong with people?

description.p: The cops picked up a tailor from Sector 17, Vashi, yesterday, following allegations of sexual assault on a minor girl. The Times of India reported the arrest but didn't name the accused.
The victim's family filed the FIR at the Vashi police station. Details are sketchy, but the charges are serious. The accused is cooling his hee...

item.title: Kharghar Gets Fresh: Navi Mumbai's First Agri-Centre
item.description: TLDR: Kharghar just got greener with Navi Mumbai's first city-level agriculture centre. Finally, something interesting happens in Sector 34 besides traffic. ...

item.title: Cop Impersonator Swindles Senior Citizen Out of ₹4 Crore

blockquote.p: TLDR: A 68-year-old from Kharghar lost ₹4 Crore to a cyber fraudster posing as a police officer. Honestly, who even has that kind of money just lying around?

description.p: Kharghar resident Mr. Sharma (name changed to protect his rapidly dwindling assets) received a call last Tuesday from a person claiming to be a Cyber Crime Unit officer. The fake cop informed Sharma that his bank accounts were compromised and needed "securing."
Sound familiar? It...

item.title: RCB Dominates Navi Mumbai: WPL 2026 Favorites?

blockquote.p: TLDR: RCB had a clean sweep in the Navi Mumbai leg of WPL 2026. Looks like Smriti Mandhana's squad came to win, not just participate.

description.p: Is it just us, or is the Women's Premier League actually exciting this year? RCB, written off before a single ball was bowled, just wrapped up a perfect run at the DY Patil Stadium.
Smriti Mandhana’s side didn't just win; they steamrolled the competition. Forget nail-biters; these were proper, convincing...

item.title: K Raheja Corp: New School Coming to Navi Mumbai

blockquote.p: TLDR: K Raheja Corp is building a school in Navi Mumbai. Finally, some good news that isn't about another delayed infrastructure project.

description.p: K Raheja Corp is adding a school to its property portfolio in Navi Mumbai. No specific location was given, because obviously.
Details are scarce, but the real estate giant is expanding into education, apparently. Will it be another fancy international school charging lakhs? Place your bets ...

item.title: Wipro Doubles Down on Airoli, Mindspace

blockquote.p: TLDR: Wipro just leased 1.45 lakh sq ft in Mindspace, Airoli. Looks like someone's betting big on Navi Mumbai... or just got a sweet deal.

description.p: Wipro's planting a flag – a big one – in Airoli's Mindspace. We're talking 1.45 lakh sq ft of prime office space. That's enough room to house approximately 1,500 more souls! The IT giant is clearly bullish on its Navi Mumbai operations.
Is this a sign of Navi Mumbai's continued rise as an IT hub? Or...

item.title: BJP Back in Power After Decade-Long NMMC Hiatus

blockquote.p: TLDR: BJP snagged 66 seats in the NMMC. Good turnout, everyone's pretending to care about local elections again.

description.p: The BJP is back, baby! After a ten-year break, they've bulldozed their way back into control of the NMMC. Looks like विकास (progress) is back on the menu, folks.
They grabbed 66 seats in the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation. Word on the street is that voters actually showed up this time, which is a shocker. Usually, these c...

item.title: Teen Killed: Love, Lies, and Nerul Nightmare

blockquote.p: TLDR: An 18-year-old is dead after a fight over a girl in Nerul. The twist? Her little brother is allegedly involved.

description.p: The Sector 21 love triangle took a deadly turn this week. Cops say Nikhil Jadhav, 18, was beaten to death near the old Nerul dumping ground. What started as a teenage squabble ended with a boy gone and five others in custody, including the girl’s younger brother. Seriously, what is going on with these kids?
According t...

item.title: NMMC Election Results: Shock Landslide, Incumbent Party Swept Out

blockquote.p: TLDR: The opposition just steamrolled the NMMC elections. Expect dramatic changes at the civic HQ in Belapur.

description.p: Belapur's political landscape just got nuked. Early results show a near-total wipeout for the ruling coalition. Sector 15 is buzzing – nobody saw this coming.
Multiple sources are calling it a "referendum on corruption." Remember the ₹80 Crore road resurfacing scam? Voters sure did.
The opposition, riding a wave of anti...

item.title: Elderly Navi Mumbaikar Loses ₹4 Crore to Scammers

blockquote.p: TLDR: A senior citizen in Navi Mumbai got scammed out of ₹4 Crore. Scammers are working overtime, and maybe it's time to hide under a rock.

description.p: Another day, another cybercrime. This time, some poor soul in Navi Mumbai kissed ₹4 Crore goodbye thanks to those digital bandits. Seriously, is anyone safe?
Details are scarce, but the Times of India reports that an elderly resident fell victim to sophisticated cyber fraud. Crores, GONE. This isn'...

item.title: Tamhini Ghat Murder: Key Suspect Nabbed by Police

blockquote.p: TLDR: Police caught the main guy in the Tamhini Ghat murder case. About damn time they did.

description.p: The Navi Mumbai police finally caught a break in the Tamhini Ghat murder case, nabbing a key suspect. After weeks of what felt like a dead end, investigators got their guy.
The accused was picked up near Panvel early this morning. Details are still trickling in, but sources within the Kharghar police station confirm it's a major development. T...

item.title: Airport signal woes? Telcos want TRAI to fix.

blockquote.p: TLDR: Mobile networks near the new Navi Mumbai airport are reportedly a mess. Telcos are begging TRAI to step in before it becomes a total communication black hole.

description.p: Chaos is brewing before the first flight even takes off. Telcos are officially fed up with signal issues plaguing the area around the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA).
Apparently, getting a decent mobile signal near Sector 112 is harder than finding parking...

item.title: Chougule Family Owns Airoli-Digha: Dynasty Confirmed

blockquote.p: TLDR: The Chougule family basically runs Airoli-Digha now, politically speaking. Is anyone really surprised that local politics feels like a family business?

description.p: Looks like the Chougules are the new kings of Airoli-Digha. Newsband is reporting that the family has solidified its political grip on the area.
Basically, if you want anything done in Wards 1 through whatever, you're going through them. Ward dominance confirmed.
